question: Some of your data in Column C is displaying as hashtags (#) because the column is too narrow. How can you widen Column C just enough to show all the data?
options: Right-click column C, select Format Cells, and then select Best-Fit.
Right-click column C and select Best-Fit.
Double-click the vertical boundary between columns C and D.
answer: Double-click the vertical boundary between columns C and D.

question: Which two functions check for the presence of numerical or nonnumerical characters in cells?

If cell A3 contains the text THE DEATH OF CHIVALRY, what will the function `=PROPER(A3)` return?
In the worksheet below, you want to use Data > Subtotal to show a subtotal value per sport. What must you do BEFORE applying the Subtotal function?
options: Sort by the data in Column E.
Format the data in Column D.
Sort by the data in Column D.
Format the data in Column E.
answer: Sort by the data in Column D.

question: When editing a cell, what do you press to cycle between relative, mixed, and absolute cell references?
You need to add a line chart showing a sales trends over the last 12 months and you have only a little space to work with. How can you convey the required information within a single cell?
options: Add an image of the chart to a comment.
Add a hyperlink to another worksheet that displays a chart when clicked.
Add an image of the chart to the worksheet.
Add a sparkline, a graphic that summarizes data visually within a single worksheet cell.
answer: Add a sparkline, a graphic that summarizes data visually within a single worksheet cell.

question: What is the best way to activate the Excel Help system?
options: Press F1 or click the Help tab in the ribbon.
answer: Press F1 or click the Help tab in the ribbon.

question: Which format will display the value 27,500,000 as 27.5?

options: Show in Compact For or Show in Outline Form
Show in Tabular Form or Show in Outline Form
answer: Show in Tabular Form or Show in Outline Form

question: Which formula is NOT equivalent to all of the others?
What custom formatting can be applied to make the cells in column A resemble the cells in column B?
Which function returns a reference to a cell (or cell range) that is a specified distance from a base cell?
You're working with columns whose width and font-size should not be changed. Yet the columns are too narrow to display all the text in each cell. What tool should you use to solve the problem?
Of the four chart types listed, which works best for summarizing time-based data?
The AutoSum formulas in the range C9:F9 below return unexpected values. Why is this?
options: The AutoSum formulas refer to the column to the left of their cells.
The AutoSum formulas exclude the bottom row of data.
The AutoSum formulas include the year at the top of each column in the calculation.
The AutoSum formulas include their own cells, creating a circular reference.
answer: The AutoSum formulas include the year at the top of each column in the calculation.

question: The text filter in column A is designed to display only those rows where column A entry has a particular attribute. What is this attribute?
options: The second character in the cell is 9.
The number 9 appears one or more times within the cell.
The cell is comprised of 9 characters.
The number 9 appears once and only once within the cell.
answer: The second character in the cell is 9.

question: An organization chart, which shows the hierarchy within a company or organization, is available as \_ that is included with Excel.

Which function returns the largest value amongst all values within the range H2:H30?

In the image below, what does clicking the button indicated by the green arrow do?
options: Hides or shows the formula bar.

question: Which formula returns the value in cell A1 of the worksheet named MySheet?

Which formula correctly counts the number of numeric values in both B4:E4 and G4:I4?
After activating a chart, which sequence adds a trendline to the chart?
options: In the Format group, select Trendline from the Insert Shapes list.
Click outside the plot area and select Add Trendline
Click inside the plot and select Forecast.
Right-click a data series and select Add Trendline.
answer: Right-click a data series and select Add Trendline.

question: Which Excel add-in will help you find a target result by varying multiple inputs to a formula?

When you sort a list of numerical value into ascending or descending order, the value in the middle of the list is the \_.
Which format setting does not change the background appearance of a cell?
In Excel, what do most formulas begin with?

You need to determine the commission earned by each Sales Rep, based on the Sales amounts in B3:B50 and the Commission rate specified in cell A1. You want to enter a formula in C3 and copy it down to C50. Which formula should you use?
If you start a date series by dragging down the fill handle of a single cell that contains the date 12/1/19, what will you get?
options: a series of consecutive days following the initial date
a series of days exactly one month apart
a series of days identical to the initial date
a series of days exactly one year apart
answer: a series of consecutive days following the initial date

question: To discover how many cells in a range contain values that meet a single criterion, use the \_ function.
Your worksheet has the value 27 in cell B3. What value is returned by the function `=MOD (B3,6)`?
For an IF function to check whether cell B3 contains a value between 15 and 20 inclusively, what condition should you use?

Cell A20 displays an orange background when its value is 5. Changing the value to 6 changes the background color to green. What type of formatting is applied to cell A20?
What does this formula do? `=Sum(Sheet1:Sheet4!D18)`
options: It adds data from cell D18 of Sheet1 and cell D18 of Sheet4
It adds data from cell A1 of Sheet1 and cell D18 of sheet4
It adds all data in the range A1:D18 in Sheet1, Sheet2, Sheet3 and Sheet4
It adds data from all D18 cells in Sheet1, Sheet2, Sheet3 and Sheet4
answer: It adds data from all D18 cells in Sheet1, Sheet2, Sheet3 and Sheet4

question: What is the term for an expression that is entered into a worksheet cell and begins with an equal sign?
How does the appearance of an array formula differ from that of a standard formula?
options: In a worksheet cell, array formulas have a small blue triangle in the cell's upper-right corner.
A heavy border appears around the range that is occupied by the array formula.
In the formula bar, an array formula appears surrounded by curly brackets.
When a cell that contains an array formula is selected, range finders appear on the worksheet around the formula's precedent cells.
answer: In the formula bar, an array formula appears surrounded by curly brackets.

question: In a worksheet, column A contains employee last names, column B contains their middle initials (if any), and column C contains their first names. Which tool can combine the last names, initials, and first names in column D without using a worksheet formula?

options: Add a new Summarize Value By field.

question: You need to determine the commission earned by each Sales rep, based on the Sales amount in B3:B50 and the Commission rate specified in cell A1. You want to enter a formula in C3 and copy it down to C50. Which formula should you use?
The `NOW()` function returns the current date and time as 43740.665218. Which part of this value indicates the time?

options: Cell A2 contains the value 8 and cell B2 is empty.
Cell A2 contains the value 8 and cell B2 contains the value 9.
Cell A2 contains the value 17 and cell B2 is empty.
answer: Cell A2 contains the value 8 and cell B2 is empty.

options: the Inventory worksheet in the Colors workbook
the Inventory column in the Colors table
the Colors worksheet in the Inventory workbook
the named range Colors[Inventory], which does not use Format as Table Feature
answer: the Inventory column in the Colors table

question: Which `VLOOKUP` function, when entered into cell L2 and then dragged to cell L5, returns the average number of calls for the representative IDs listed in column J?

The PivotTable below has one row field and two column fields. How can you pivot this table to show the column fields as subtotals of each value in the row field?
options: On the PivotTable itself, drag each `Average` field into the row fields area.
Right-click a cell in the PivotTable and select `PivotTable Options > Classic PivotTable layout`.
In the `PivotTable Fields` pane, drag `Sum Values` from the `Columns` section to a location below the field in the `Rows` section.
In the `PivotTable Fields` pane, drag each field from the `Sum Values` section to the `Rows` section.
answer: In the `PivotTable Fields` pane, drag `Sum Values` from the `Columns` section to a location below the field in the `Rows` section.

question: Which Excel feature allows you to hide rows or columns with an easily visible expand/collapse?

columns: event / row:donor / values: Sum of amount
rows:donor, event / values: Sum of amount
filter: event / row:donor / values: Sum of amount
answer: rows:donor, event / values: Sum of amount

question: In the worksheet shown below, cell C6 contains the formula `=VLOOKUP(A6,$F$2:$G$10,2,FALSE)`. What is the most likely reason that `#N/A` is returned in cell `C6` instead of mallory's `ID (2H54)`
options: The absolute/relative cell references in the formula are wrong
Cell A6 is not actualy text its a formula that need to be copied and pasted as a value
Column C in the lookup range is not sorted properly
A trailing space probably exist in cell A6 or F7
answer: A trailing space probably exist in cell A6 or F7

question: What is the difference between pressing the delete key and using the clear command in the Home tab's Editing group?
options: Deletes removes the entire column or row. Clear removes the content from the column or row
Deletes removes formulas, values and hyperlinks. clear removes formulas, values, hyperlinks, formats, comments and notes
Delete removes the cell itself, shifting cells either up or to the left. Clear removes content and properties but does not muves cells
Delete removes formulas and values. clear removes formulas, values, hyperlinks, formats, comments and notes
answer: Deletes removes formulas, values and hyperlinks. clear removes formulas, values, hyperlinks, formats, comments and notes

question: What is the intersection of a worksheet row and column?

options: Use weight as a filter field as well as a row field in the PivotTable.
Use `IF()` to show weight by categories instead of by pounds.
Click the _Row Labels_ arrow and select _Group_.
Right-click any row field value in the PivotTable and select _Group_.
answer: Right-click any row field value in the PivotTable and select _Group_.

question: How can you drill down into a PivotTable to show details?
options: Select the cell into which you want to drill down, right-click, and select _Show Summary_.
Select the cell into which you want to drill down, right-click and select _Drill-down_.
Select the cell into which you want to drill down and double-click.
Select the cell into which you want to drill down, right-click and select _Show Details > Summary Page_
answer: Select the cell into which you want to drill down and double-click.

options: Click D2's fill handle and drag it down to D501.

options: Select column G, then right-click and select `Unhide`.
Select column C, then right-click and select `Unhide`.
On the Page Layout tab, in the `Rows` and `Columns` section, select `Unhide`.
Click and drag to select columns C and G, then right-click and select `Unhide`.
answer: Click and drag to select columns C and G, then right-click and select `Unhide`.

question: Before publishing a document, you want to identify issues that may make it difficult for people with disabilities to read. Which feature should you use?

options: Select the image and, on the `Picture Tools Format` tab, use the `Compress Picture` feature.
Select the image and, on the `Design` tab, use the `Format Background` feature.
On the `Drawing Tools Format` tab, select `Graphics Fill` > `Remove Background`.
Select the image and, on the `Picture Tools Format` tab, click the Remove Background button.
answer: Select the image and, on the `Picture Tools Format` tab, click the Remove Background button.

question: What is the result of the formula =4&3?
How do you remove everything (values, formatting, etc.) from a cell?
options: Select the cell. On the Home tab, click Clear.
Select the cell and press Delete.
Right-click the cell and select Delete.
Select the cell. On the Home tab, click Clear > Clear All.
answer: Select the cell. On the Home tab, click Clear > Clear All.

question: What is the difference between a workbook and a worksheet?
options: An Excel file is a workbook. A workbook contains one or more worksheets.
Nothing-these two terms mean the same thing.
A workbook contains only data. A worksheet contains both data and formulas.
An Excel file is a worksheet. A worksheet contains one or more workbooks.
answer: An Excel file is a workbook. A workbook contains one or more worksheets.

question: How would you connect the slicer to both PivotTables?
options: You cannot use one slicer for two PivotTables.
Right-click the slicer and select Slicer Settings.
Merge the two PivotTables, right-click the merged PivotTable, and select Combine Slicer.
Right-click the slicer and select Report Connections, or click Report Connections on the Slicer tab.
answer: Right-click the slicer and select Report Connections, or click Report Connections on the Slicer tab.

question: How would you search an entire workbook with **Find & Select**?
options: On the **Home** tab, click **Find & Select > Find > Options** (Windows) or **Find & Select > Find** (Mac). Change the **Within** drop-down to **Workbook**.
On the **Home** tab, click **Find & Select > Find > Options** (Windows) or **Find & Select > Find** (Mac). Change the **Look in** drop-down to **Workbook**.
On the **Home** tab, click **Find & Select > Find > Options** (Windows) or **Find & Select > Find** (Mac). Change the **Search** drop-down to **All**.
You cannot search an entire workbook - you must search the worksheets individually.
answer: On the **Home** tab, click **Find & Select > Find > Options** (Windows) or **Find & Select > Find** (Mac). Change the **Within** drop-down to **Workbook**.

question: You are determining `%` growth by dividing Growth by Sales. Which Excel function would you use to avoid #DIV/0! errors?

Use Page Setup from the Backstage View.
Use Freeze Panes on the View tab.
Format your data as a table; the header prints automatically.
answer: Use Print Titles on the Page Layout tab.

Cells A2:D2 are the source of an error in the formula in cell C4.

question: How do you remove only the conditional formatting from a cell and leave all other formatting intact?
options: This is not possible-you can remove only all formatting from a cell.
Select the cell. On the Home tab, click Conditional Formatting > Clear Rules > Clear Rules from Selected Cells.
Right-click the cell and select Delete Conditional Formatting.
Right-click the cell and select Remove Conditional Formatting.
answer: Select the cell. On the Home tab, click Conditional Formatting > Clear Rules > Clear Rules from Selected Cells.

question: If a range name is used in a formula and the name is deleted, what happens to the formula?
options: The formula display a warning but the actual cell address is substituted for the deleted name.
The formula becomes invalid and displays a #NAME? error.
The actual cell addresses replace the original range name in the formula.
The formula becomes invalid and displays a #N/A error
answer: The formula becomes invalid and displays a #NAME? error.

On the Formulas tab, click Trace errors.
On the Formulas tab, click show formulas
answer: On the Home tab, click Go To > Special > Column differences.

question: What is one way to center text in a cell?
options: Right-click the cell and select **Center** (Windows) or **Center Text** (Mac).
Select the cell and, on the **View** tab in the **Cells** section, click **Alignment** and select **Center** (Windows) or **Center Text** (Mac).
Select the cell and, on the **Home** tab in the **Alignment** section, click **Center** (Windows) or **Center Text** (Mac).
Change the width of the cell until the **text** is centered.
answer: Select the cell and, on the **Home** tab in the **Alignment** section, click **Center** (Windows) or **Center Text** (Mac).

question: Cell D1 contains the value 7.877. You want cell D1 to display this value as 7.9 but keep the original number in calculations. How can you accomplish this?
options: In the **Cells** group on the **Home** tab, click **Format > Format Cells**. Then click the **Alignment** tab and select **Right Indent**.

question: Given the image below, what happens if you type "P" in cell A6?

question: Other than pasting an image, how can you insert an image file from your computer into a worksheet?
options: On the **Insert** tab, click **Pictures > This Device** (Windows) or **Pictures > Picture from file** (Mac)
On the **Insert** tab, click **SmartArt > Copy Image from Device** (Windows) or **SmartArt > Copy** (Mac)

On the **Insert** tab, click **Icons > Insert > Picture from This Device**
answer: On the **Insert** tab, click **Pictures > This Device** (Windows) or **Pictures > Picture from file** (Mac)

question: You want to restrict a user from entering any amount greater than $100 or less than $20 in a row. Which Excel feature would you use?

How do you override Excel's automatic axis scaling to enter custom axis maximum and minimum values?
options: You cannot do this in Excel.
Right-click the axis, select **Format Axis**, and scroll to the desired minimum and maximum values.
Right-click the axis and select **Format Axis > Axis Options**. Then change the minimum and maximum values.
Click the individual axis values and change them manually.
answer: Right-click the axis and select **Format Axis > Axis Options**. Then change the minimum and maximum values.

question: Given the source data, how do you transform the middle PivotTable to appear like the rightmost PivotTable?

answer: Right-click any row field value in the pivot table and select Group.
